Topic.Title: How do you remove the text that pops up when you enter a room? SOLVED

Posts.EditableText: e.g You are in The Room. I want just the description if possible but don't know how. (Not web ver)
Posts.HTML: e.g You are in The Room. I want just the description if possible but don't know how. (Not web ver)

Posts.EditableText:
On the game's "Room Descriptions" tab, there is a list of 4 sections. Description, "you are in", "you can see", and "you can go".

You can put a number next to each of them to choose the order it does them in.

What Quest actually does is:
1. Display the section(s) with number 1
2. Display the section(s) with number 2
3. Display the section(s) with number 3
4. Display the section(s) with number 4

So if you set one of them to a number other than 1, 2, 3, or 4, it won't appear at all.

You can put a number next to each of them to choose the order it does them in.

What Quest actually does is:

  1. Display the section(s) with number 1
  2. Display the section(s) with number 2
  3. Display the section(s) with number 3
  4. Display the section(s) with number 4

So if you set one of them to a number other than 1, 2, 3, or 4, it won't appear at all.

Posts.EditableText: If you just want to do this for one room, you can use the "before enter" script to change the numeric values of the attributes `this.autodescription_youarein`, `this.autodescription_youcansee`, `this.autodescription_youcango`, and `this.autodescription_description`; and then use the room's "enter" script to change them back again after the description is shown.
